alert.note: Alert for Humboldt County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 3:58PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Humboldt County through 430 PM PDT... At 358 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles southeast of Paradise Valley, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of eastern Humboldt County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
